page.title: 11THE PRIORY CHURCH
page.content: The Domesday Book mentions the parish under its the name of Est Depinge. The Priory Church was built in 1139 as a cell to Thorney Abbey but the spire and tower were rebuilt in 1717.The font is made from a single block of Caen stone and has patterns of Norman arches round the side.During the 18th century the nave roof was lowered and flat ceilings erected. During recent repairs a stone coffin of the 13th century was discovered.The coffin was supporting the floor and contained the major part of a skeleton.The organ is of fine quality, it was built in St.Martins Church, Lincoln about 1911.The church originally had five bells dating from 1608 to 1704 but a sixth bell has been added in recent years.The whole peal weighs over four tons.
